Basic.name: Missing HSTS Header
Basic.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security header is missing, which helps protect against protocol downgrade attacks
Basic.evidence: Header Strict-Transport-Security not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the Strict-Transport-Security header with a max-age of at least 31536000 (1 year) and includeSubDomains directive

Basic.name: Missing Content Security Policy
Basic.description: Content Security Policy header is missing, which helps mitigate XSS and other code injection attacks
Basic.evidence: Header Content-Security-Policy not found in response
Basic.remediation: Implement a Content Security Policy with appropriate directives for your site

Basic.name: Missing X-Frame-Options Header
Basic.description: X-Frame-Options header is missing, which can lead to clickjacking attacks
Basic.evidence: Header X-Frame-Options not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the X-Frame-Options header with DENY or SAMEORIGIN value

Basic.name: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header
Basic.description: X-Content-Type-Options header is missing, which can lead to MIME sniffing attacks
Basic.evidence: Header X-Content-Type-Options not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the X-Content-Type-Options header with nosniff value

Basic.name: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header
Basic.description: X-XSS-Protection header is missing, which can help prevent XSS attacks in older browsers
Basic.evidence: Header X-XSS-Protection not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the X-XSS-Protection header with 1; mode=block value

Basic.name: Missing Referrer-Policy Header
Basic.description: Referrer-Policy header is missing, which controls how much referrer information is included with requests
Basic.evidence: Header Referrer-Policy not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the Referrer-Policy header with appropriate value like no-referrer or same-origin

Basic.name: Missing Permissions-Policy Header
Basic.description: Permissions-Policy header is missing, which controls which browser features can be used
Basic.evidence: Header Permissions-Policy not found in response
Basic.remediation: Add the Permissions-Policy header to restrict access to sensitive browser features

Basic.name: Missing Clear-Site-Data Header on Logout
Basic.description: Clear-Site-Data header can be used to clear browsing data associated with a site during logout
Basic.evidence: Header Clear-Site-Data not found in response
Basic.remediation: Consider adding Clear-Site-Data header to logout responses

Basic.name: Server Information Disclosure
Basic.description: Server header reveals information about the server software: nginx/1.19.0
Basic.remediation: Configure the server to hide version information

Basic.name: X-Powered-By Information Disclosure
Basic.description: X-Powered-By header reveals information about the server technology: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1

Basic.name: Insecure HTTP
Basic.description: The website is using HTTP instead of HTTPS, which means data is transmitted in plaintext
Basic.remediation: Configure the server to use HTTPS and redirect HTTP to HTTPS

Basic.name: Open Port: 80 (HTTP)
Basic.description: Port 80 (HTTP - Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is open on testphp.vulnweb.com
Basic.remediation: Close port 80 if not needed or restrict access with a firewall

SQL_Injection.name: SQL Injection

SQL_Injection.evidence: Parameter 'searchFor' with payload '' OR (SELECT 'x' FROM users WHERE username='admin' AND LENGTH(password)>5) --' triggered error pattern: SQL syntax.*?MySQL
SQL_Injection.remediation: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements. Validate and sanitize all user inputs.

File_Upload.name: Potential File Upload Paths Detected
File_Upload.description: Found 56 potential file upload paths that could be used for file upload attacks
File_Upload.evidence: Found 56 upload directories (6 verified, 0 with directory listing)
File_Upload.remediation: Review and secure these upload paths. Consider implementing proper access controls and validations for file uploads.

File_Upload.name: Multiple Upload Paths on testphp.vulnweb.com
File_Upload.description: Found 56 potential file upload paths on testphp.vulnweb.com (6 verified)
File_Upload.evidence: Paths: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/images, http://testphp.vulnweb.com/images, http://testphp.vulnweb.com/pictures, http://testphp.vulnweb.com/pictures, http://testphp.vulnweb.com/admin...
File_Upload.remediation: Review and secure upload directories. Implement proper access controls and file validation.
